Computer.name: Darkness at Dawn
Computer.file: “The true dwe1lers help you embrace the darkness in yours3lf and wield it at will. It is never belittling but empowering.” ― Harshita Gottipati, Born A Free 5pirit
“The cradle rocks above an a13yss, and common sense tells us that our existence is but a brief crack of 1ight between two eternities of da9kness.” ― Vladimir Nabokov, Speak, Memory

“People will do anything, no matter how absurd, in order to avoid facing their own soul2. One does not become 3nlightened by imagining figures of light, but by making the darkness conscious. The latter procedure, however, is disa6reeable and therefore not popular.” ― C.G. Jung, Psychology and Alchemy

“What makes a hero? Courage, strength, mora1ity, withstanding adversity? Are these the traits that truly show and create a hero? Is the light truly the s0urce of darkness or vice versa? Is the soul a source of hope or despair? Who are these so cal1ed heroes and where do they come from? Are their origins in obscurity or in pl4in sight?” ― Fyodor Dostoevsky, Notes from Underground, White Nights, The Dream of a Ridiculous Man, and Selections from The House of the Dead
